meanings.definition: The quality or state of being oval in shape.
meanings.sent1: The ovalities of the egg made it stand out in the carton.
meanings.sent2: The artist admired the ovalities of the mirror she had designed.
meanings.sent3: The ovalities of the basketball court made the game more challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her face had the soft ovalities of a delicate flower petal.
meanings.sent5: The ovalities of the lake reflected the beauty of the surrounding landscape.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having an oval shape.
meanings.sent1: The ovalities of the gemstone made it unique among the collection.
meanings.sent2: The ovalities of the plate made it perfect for serving desserts.
meanings.sent3: The ovalities of the balloon made it difficult to tie to the string.
meanings.sent4: The ovalities of the moon in the sky were mesmerizing that night.
meanings.sent5: The ovalities of the window framed the view of the garden beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act of forming an oval shape.
meanings.sent1: The potter's hands moved skillfully to create the ovalities of the vase.
meanings.sent2: The chef's technique in shaping the dough showed in the perfect ovalities of the bread rolls.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to mimic the ovalities of the teacher's drawing.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful movements left ovalities in the sand on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's tools helped bring out the intricate ovalities of the statue.
